tasks.task: Starting a farm or garden with ease by growing profitable crops.
subtasks: Researching profitable crops suitable for beginners.
Planting radishes in well-drained soil.
Growing lettuce using the cut-and-come-again method.
Cultivating herbs (e.g., basil, mint, cilantro) in pots or garden beds.
Cultivating green beans vertically.
Growing zucchini for high yield.
Planting potatoes for a longer growing season.
Growing sunflowers for seeds or flowers.
Starting small to manage resources effectively.
Researching market demand for crops.
Improving soil health with compost.
Regularly watering plants, especially lettuce and herbs.
Implementing organic pest management.
Choosing easy-to-grow crops for minimal effort.
Discussing radishes, lettuce, herbs, green beans, zucchini, potatoes, and sunflowers.
Providing tips for successful crop growth.
Recommending small-scale farming for beginners.
Considering market demand when choosing crops.
Suggesting investment in soil health and water management.
Advising on pest control methods.
